overview:
Head of Business Automation Department, EDISON Software Development Centre, Russia

As a schoolboy Eugene took part in many regional maths, physics, and chemistry competitions, winning numerous prizes and awards. He played basketball and volleyball. Eugene also did woodwork and was interested in handicrafts. He finished school with honours.

Eugene then went to the capital of the Kuznetsk Basin from the faraway town of Novovostochniy to continue his education. He successfully graduated from the mathematics faculty of Kemerovo State University, majoring in Applied Mathematics, and immediately applied for post-graduate study. At that time he was greatly interested in philosophy, psychology and its practical application.

Eugene came to EDISON Software Development Centre with the offer of creating a new business automation department. Since then he has been successfully leading this important subdivision of EDISON. Eugene is really in his element when working because of his attention to detail, interpersonal skills, and team spirit. He is convinced that the success of any project depends on the amount of effort invested in its accomplishment. To be successful, one must strive for results; applying theoretical knowledge and practical skills. Eugene supervised the “EFSIN” project, which was of great social significance to Russia. In just a short time, several internet-shops created for penitentiary system institutions have grown into a large network and become a Russia-wide brand.

Eugene is also very active in his free time and is a keen cyclist.
